comments.commentBody:
I would suggest that the answer to your question is that ethnicity is harder to hide than sexual orientation. A number of Cuban born players in Major League baseball in the 20's concealed the fact that they had African ancestry.

As far as numbers, I predict 10%. That is the proportion of the population as a whole which is estimated to be gay and I bet that number holds in sports and everywhere else.

Homosexuality and sports has always been a real puzzle to me. With race, sport was way AHEAD of the rest of society in accepting people for their talent alone. Why in the case of sexual orientation has it LAGGED in such a severe way?

I do not see an avalanche, but rather a trickle, since I suspect (though do not know) that the actually proportion of gay males is quite a bit lower among elite athletes. Hopefully, as homophobia ebbs, this will become more clear in the coming years.

"It was followed by Bear Stearns"????It was preceded by Bear
"How easily we forget!" You forget we remember

."Today, the stock market has roared back" Let's see who should we give credit for that?The name comes to mind B.Bernanke.I was under impression he is totally independent from President and report to Congress.

"the stock market has roared back to its pre-recession levels"

yes, and unemployment is still +8% and home mortgages are still caving in.

the stock market and 1% are dancing and STILL want to take over the country to grab even more, while the workers suffer.

romney/ryan are trying to ride the wave of that discontent, the stock market and the 1% continued wealth is r/r's little "secret," not the kind of news they want broadcast to the people whose votes they need.

Exactly four years ago, Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy protection. It was followed by Bear Stearns, and, in the days and weeks that followed, Stocks skidded with the Dow slumping nearly 778 points, in the biggest single-day point loss ever. The day's loss knocked out approximately $1.2 trillion in market value and in peopl's wealth. Today, the stock market has roared back to its pre-recession levels.

How easily we forget!
Or at least Romney / Ryan want us to.

steve hunter, seattle

AAC, when Romney had a lead you were citing them.

***
Actually, Steve, Romney does have a lead in certain polls.

I question the assumption that Obama's number will not come down again. And go back up and then come down.

Get my point?

Wow. And all these statistics we're getting from the Charter School Dog & Pony Show about how it's the public schools' responsibility that minorities and poor students drop out of college at an alarming rate.

You always have to look at what Clinton would call the Arithmetic.

Pablo,

That was my son's experience in the 1990's at Georgetown University. I coughed up $16 K half way through his sophomore year on a day's notice and sent it FedEx with an application to the University of California. Good decision, even though many credits did not transfer and it was an extra year at UC for him to graduate.

Yet another way that income and wealth are transferred from the poorer to the affluent and their institutions, and the gap between them is increased.   We do not know what will happen when the poorer are squeezed dry, and we are running an experiment to find out.

I teach at CUNY and I have had dozens of students telling me the same story: they are lured into going to small, not so prestigious, private colleges by generous financial aid packages, all of which include loans. Most of them come from working class families, often they are the first ones to go to college, often their parents are immigrants with practically no knowledge whatsoever about the way US higher education works. They all are bedazzled by the mirage of a private education at a small college. After years of public education in poor neighborhoods of the city - and all that it comports -- this is a dream come through.
Little do they know that, regularly, after the first year, the school will notify them that tuition is going up and the 'award money' will drop considerably. The family finds itself suddenly under pressure to come up with loads of cash. Some, unfortunately, bite the bullet, double up on debt and continue for another year, only to give up when they face the same game next year. Lots of them give up right away. They depleted the scarce saving resources of their families and now their only option is to go to a community college or, if their grades are up to snuff, to a CUNY senior college. As they move to the new schools, not all the credits transfer, thus they find themselves in debt and behind their peers, in addition to feeling betrayed, confused and loaded with useless debt.
And that's the way it is in higher education, USA, in the third millennium.

I'm really sorry, Bill, but your vote doesn't really count for much. You live in HEAVILY Democratic New York. See below:

GALLUP POLITICS

August 3, 2012

Heavily Democratic States Are Concentrated in the East

Three Western states are the most Republican

by Lydia Saad

PRINCETON, NJ -- Along with the District of Columbia, Rhode Island and Hawaii rank as the most Democratic states in the country, followed by New York, Maryland, and Massachusetts. Rounding out the top 10 Democratic states are Delaware, Connecticut, Vermont, and California. Utah, Idaho, and Wyoming are the most Republican states.

Move to the South, or West, Young Man, if you are Republican. Your vote will count there.
You know there are 311 million people in your country, plus a few more hiding, so it might take a little time before they get round to you, Bill.

I am 57 years old, live in Levittown,NY, and I have never, repeat never been polled by your newspaper. What do you do, redpoll all the same people. For the record, I will proudly be voting this November for Mitt Romney. Please add that to your polling results.

Obama's utter brilliance is too bright for you to see.  The Fed and Treasury heads were appointed by a Republican and when Obama was elected...He didn't do what comes naturally...kick the bums out...He made them fix what they broke...because he knew they knew where all the dead bodies were buried.
How easily people forget that in the last Bush year, $16 trillion of household wealth was literally wiped out! Now that was bad!

The Fed has been near begging Congress to do somehting and move the Jobs bill forward.  The Repubs refuse.  What the House offers for "jobs " is insignificant.  They are just waiting it out to deny the President and the country a move forward.

Baloney.  Obama is not winning, his economy is so bad the Fed is now printing money, and foreign policy is shattered.  As this settles in on voters Romney will surge away from Neville Chamberlain, oops, Obama.

There´s something odious about taking a pension away from a person who has worked his entire career counting on it for his retirement, and then providing absolutely nothing in support or consideration once the deed is done. This systematic dismantling of pensions is precisely what Romney has been up to without apology for all of his working career, and how he has made his many millions. And if we are to believe him, this is precisely what america needs more of and he knows how to do it.

I wouldn't trust unfit mitt with enough of my cash to buy a sandwich at lunch time. He has proven only that he knows how to get other people's money into his own pocket in staggering amounts, and that he knows how to hide that money in offshore accounts to game the tax code. The three worst president on the economy in all the nation's history also not coincidentally are the only three businessmen. Collidge, hoover and Dubya.

As for the "narrative" that Oama is winning - there has not been a time since the race began that this was not the case. Unfit Mitt came close to a stistical tie in national polls for about 4 minutes after his convention, bu that is as close as he has been. Best guess is Obama will get at least 310 in the electoral college.

At this point, what all Americans need to work toward is making sure that Democrats take back the House from the tea bagging crazies, and do not lose control of the senate. If the nut jobs have congress then we will sit and spin our wheels at least until the next mid terms. We will stagnate becasue republicons have proved they are do nothing, know nothing windbags. And while they block our own nation the rest of the world will pass us by.
I think Obama has been doing a good job. Takes a lot of effort to run the country and run for re-election at the same time. Everyone should head over to HugObama.com and give him a hug!

Keep hoping, I guess.

Oh, that's right.

Republican's were snarking about how infantile it was for President Obama to run on a platform of HOPE.
Reagan led from May onwards in the average of all polls in 1980; it is an urban myth that Carter led all the way. This sort of thing is made up by Fox News. It just isn't true.

I remember that glorious evening in November 1980 when Ronald Reagan defeated Jimmy Carter in a landslide after all polls throughout the summer and the fall had indicated otherwise.

Today's world situation is as closely corroborative as I've ever seen to that world-changing day.

I'm thinking, then, that poll results within the margin of error are very bad news to an incumbent president burdened by economic malaise and Muslim challenges.
Polls are leaning the wrong way for Romney and he's getting so desperate he's beginning to sound a lot like Sarah Palin.  Snark is not Presidential.

Yes, it does. But the NBC, etc., polls have been found to over sample democrats. So, the polls can send incorrect signals.

In the end, it's the people who actually go out and vote.
AAC: Rassmussen always trends several points toward the Republican side.  Its been noted by many pollsters not just Nate Silver.
One thing you don't believe is the Rasmussen poll it is controlled by Fox Lies and Carl Rove.
Let everyone do his job. Pollster are regularly carrying out surveys. The voters are smart and they will decide whats right for them?

THEN Romney by your first criteria would be our best president, he is the most prolific liar ever to seek the office.
The only truth to come out of the campaign so far was today when they admitted the 911 attacks were do the the lack of resolve of Bush/Cheney.
Which of course was true but President Obama picked up their slack and polished off the perpetrators of the 911 attacks.

it seems liberals again think and act as though we are idiots. Did they just read any commentaries all over the media? I don't think so!

Or may be it is done for purpose to demoralize anti - Obama sentiment keeping them away from polling stations.

No word about fail of foreign policy and corpses of diplomats, no word that our money will continue to flow to the murderers.

Jobs? Economy? I see closing businesses everywhere and it is New York. Out of mind, honestly. I go often to Pennsylvania and see no improvement there.

Those crappy articles are annoying an shoe that the dems are out of touch.

If Romney does not even sink lower in the polls after his outrageous statements that the president is "sympathizing with the attackers" on 9/11/2012, then I can only be sure that in this country it is not the economy dummy, it is clearly the education.

Furthermore, when up to five percent of all voters still not have been able to make up their mind, their attention span is obviously that of a third grader.

I thought the same thing about the "foreign policy" bump while protests against the US and Obama are being waged around the world. Not likely.

To think that Obama felt the Muslim world would change its views of the US because he was "one with them. He obviously forgot about the violent extremists who aren't "one" with him at all. They've got their own agenda, which seems to have been a surprise to Obama and Hillary.

'Obama's Middle East Policy is in Ruins', obviously your favorit pick, was published in ‘Die Welt‘, a conservative right wing newspaper in Germany.

Displayed on Spiegel online as well, the view of ‘Handelsblatt’:
"Three years after Obama's speech in Cairo, which was supposed to initiate a new beginning in the Middle East, the United States now has even less support in the region than before. That's not a failure of this president. Instead, it is the consequences of an American foreign policy that for decades favored power over democracy, and a hard line over human rights -- and which will suffer from a credibility problem for a long time for precisely those reasons."
"Mitt Romney has, however, failed to recognize the very core of the American dilemma. He attacked Obama with twisted facts shortly after the announcement of the death of the US ambassador to Libya, Chris Stevens. He claimed that the US government had sympathized with the attackers in Benghazi. But not only was that factually wrong, it also demonstrated an alarmingly high level of foreign policy incompetence to his own party. None of this would matter, except that Romney wants Obama's job -- and might even get it on Nov. 6."

The idea of Romney, Ryan, Neocons in the White House is causing strong headaches not just inEurope. Republicans in the White House never made the world a saver place. Since the lie about WMD’s in Irak, the world knows what Republicans are capable of.

Spare the world such a déjà vu!

ACC: "He obviously forgot about the violent extremists who aren't "one" with him at all."

And the proof? All those drone missles, some of which he PERSONALLY makes careful and deliberate decisions about.

Yep, you are correct again as usual ACC: Obama has totally forgotten about violent extremists.

Rubbish.

A couple of points regarding the polls. Numbers this far ahead for Obama seem manipulated. Of course I have no proof, but a 10 point lead in foreign policy with fires raging in 20 countries? See the English version of the German newspaper Spiegel 'Obama's Middle East Policy Is in Ruins'to see what our allies really think. Why the NYTimes continues to cover for the President in this regard is very disturbing. If the poll is correct we have become a nation of ignoramuses.

Regarding the economy poll. The U6 employment rate has been estimated to be in the mid teens to lower twenties. This counts disaffected workers, contract workers not employed, people underemployed, those who have permanantly left the work force but are of age, etc. We also have record assistance of 50 million for food stamps. My sister being one and some others I know as well. She has a master's degree by the way and I know many others in her situation.

Anyways, I will be the first to admit that Romney is not my first, second, or third choice. However, I came to the realization after the open mic incident with Putin which smacked of Benedict Arnold that it was time for Obama to go. Oh yah, I voted for him so all you diehard Republicans can laugh at me. I am writing to appeal to open-minded Patriots that will do the right thing and vote Romney. If you have to hold your nose while doing it it is ok, because I'll be doing the same thing.

jonefoster is entirely correct.  We must dump most of the Republican Congress in the House, OR THINGS WILL CONTINUE TO STAGNATE.  Come Nov, dump the Republicans in the Congress no matter how decent they appear, because in the southeast and west they will keep theirs even if they are confirmed minions of Satan.

I believe that if Obama is reelected (and it appears he will be, at this point) the gridlock will be even more so than it is now. The Republican leadership would rather sink the entire ship than hand the President even a coffee can to bail it out. In 50 years of observing American politics, I've never seen such intransigence in my entire life.

It used to be that there was a give and take in Congress. I"ll give you this if you give me that. No more. For the Republican Party of today, it's scorched earth.

How I miss Dirkson, Javits, Percy, Keating, Kuchel, Hatfield, Leach, Snow, Collins, and dozens of other moderate Republicans. All the moderates have been drummed out of the GOP corps and what's left are Paleo-conservative Know-Nothings and hyper-wealthy plutocrats. It's a marriage made in hell.

The Romney campaign is in its death throes but it will not be enough to drive a wooden stake through its heart.  The people of this country need to understand that little progress will be made if the GOP retains control of the House and wins control of the Senate.  The Republican Party will see this nation's economy brought to its knees before it cooperates with President Obama to move us forward.

Hi, and welcome to the storm that GW created. I too have been laid off and have a family to support, and more. And  I don't want to hear about how it's Obama's fault. GW dug s in so deep it'll take 10 years to dig us out if we're lucky. And I mean super-lucky. What? Did you expect our new president to wave a magic wand and fix everything in four short years? Wake up, my man! Wake up!

You mean you want a real economic policy that addresses our jobs moving overseas?

Don't hold your breath. Maybe you should consider teaching or firefighting. Obama's doing as much as he possibly can for them.

And then there's always Disability, which is where most laid off men are going.

Clue in j.r.  Romney HATES unions!  He despises them and has done an excellent job brainwashing people like you to think that this is President Obama's fault.  Wake up before all our jobs go overseas!  That's what Bain Capital--the company Romney  ran--was so good at--sending American jobs--union jobs--overseas!  Get the facts!  You've worked too hard to let their con job destroy what's left of American unions!

you obama supporters just aggrivate me no end. twice during this long, endless term, i and over 500 of my fellow union workers have been laid off  because of the policies of the current white house occupant-not anything to do with the other side of the aisle. today, while at work, we were informed that as of october l5,2012, we're off again for the remainder of the year. these are not mini mart jobs but union jobs at 22 to 30 dollars an hour. on behalf of our membership, thanks again obama.  see you OUT in november.
Obama is too young to drive a great ship like America.If the future is what like you said,I will be ready to see Obama's being reelected ~.~

Repub presidents responsible for 70% of the debtb over past 50m years,
Demds have created 2 x more jobs then Repubs over past 50 years
Income inequality created by Reagan and increased by Bush.

Strock market as high as 2007. 4 Million private jobs created past 3 years- More then any president has created in past 40 years.
GDP back to 2007 level.

Sorry ,Paul you have no facts on your side. But keep the faith.
If the Republicans create wealth, where is it after those 8 years of the Bush administration of which most was spent with a Republican Congress?

If the American peopel still believe that Obama can bring America out of the recession, that only shows that they have not suffered enough, and the coldest period of winter has not come to American yet. Obama will never keep his promises, perhapse he himself understands that. I made this prediction four years ago, I will make another prediction. If he is reelected, American will be in a more serious situation than it is now. In America, the Democrats distribute wealth while the Republicans create wealth. Now life is still not so hard yet, there are still some wealth to distribute although it is borrowed wealth. The Americans will never allow a Republican to be the host of the White House until they have vertually nothing to take and share.

The reason for the poll results is that for the first time the American public heard a consistant and factual message on all of the problems Obama inherited and the steps he has taken and continues to take to correct the problems he inherited.  Even I didn't appreciate the significance of the auto bailout and how far it reached, all the way to Dayton Ohio, close to where I live.  The Republicans handed us the same 'ol.  I learned two things from the Democratic convention.  One, we are in a war in Afganistan (never mentioned by Mitt), and two, there must have been a president between Clinton and Obama.  I wonder what his name was.

No one should be complacent.  Republicans' success at voter suppression and their ruthless quest for power, combined with the 50+ days left before the election, should make everyone cautious.  The blatant, reprehensible, and treasonous lies Romney told this week, and which more and more Republicans are parroting, means they are at a new, scarier, more nefarious and evil level. Romney and company will clearly stoop to anything.

Which one's Gary, his birth certificate that he's shown numerous times and even got the Governor of Hawaii to vouch that he'd seen the originals? The birthers still wouldn't believe it, it's 'photoshoped' it's got the wrong watermark, SS number, border trim, etc.. etc.. Obama is the most vetted President in history and Romney hasn't even came up with 12 years of tax records as has all other candidates since his own father started the tradition many years ago.

Of course you understand that Mitt Romney won't understand any of these references.

Maybe if you had put them in the terms of, say, dressage.

Mitt is probably starting to feel the heat from the Koch Brothers and Adelson too. They've got a LOT of money riding on Mitt and if their boy doesn't come through they'll get no return on those hundreds of millions in donations!
